current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To address shortages and interruptions in the availability of propane and other home heating fuels
			 in the United States, and for other purposes.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Home Heating Emergency Assistance Through Transportation Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Home Heating Emergency Assistance Through Transportation Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Propane and home heating fuel emergency transportation

external-xref.#tail:
of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations, or
			 extended under section 390.25 of such title that—

text.#text:
was issued or extended during the period beginning on February 5, 2014, and ending on the date of
			 the enactment of this Act; and

provided regulatory relief for commercial motor vehicle operations providing direct assistance
			 supporting the delivery of propane and home heating fuels.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall remain in effect until May 31,
			 2014, unless the

, after consultation with the
			 Governors of affected States, determines that the emergency for which the
			 exemption was provided ended before that date.

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a covered emergency exemption issued by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may be construed to prohibit the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Home Heating Emergency Assistance Through Transportation Act of 2014/s:2/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
from issuing or extending a covered emergency exemption
			 beyond May 31, 2014.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2085 IS: Home Heating Emergency Assistance Through Transportation Act of 2014
